title: Kirchhoff junction - is X or Y at higher potential

content.question: The figure shows a portion of a circuit that includes a resistor. The currents in two of the wire segments are indicated. Which of the two labeled positions is at a higher potential, and what evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. The current in the resistor is directed toward the right.

Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. The wires at this junction all have currents directed away from point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.
Point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. The current in the resistor is toward the left.

Point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. The wires at point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> all have currents directed into point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

content.answer: Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. The current in the resistor is directed toward the right.
